answers.answer: Yellow discoloration of the skin may be associated with carotenemia (high intake of beta carotene-containing fruits and veggies), hypothyroidism, diabetes mellitus, liver disease, and renal disease.While it's most likely caused by one or both of the first two, probably wouldn't hurt to talk to your doc about ruling out the others.
